feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission describes and demonstrates a working financial tool that accepts budgeted and actual figures, computes and visualizes variances, and generates executive explanations for non-financial users. Implementation and testing evidence (Google AI Studio prompts and scenario tests) show the app functions as a financial application, meeting the criterion.
- Integrate AI: The submission shows concrete AI use (Google AI Studio) producing interactive outputs (visualizations and executive summaries) that add clear user value, and documents iterative prompt refinement and testing. These specifics across Discover/Implement/Reflect demonstrate effective AI integration beyond a superficial mention, so it passes.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "So our goal for this app is to create an MVP, variance explanation tool, that takes the user input for budgeted and actual numbers, identifies favorable and unfavorable variances, explains what happened in plain and simple English, and avoids accounting jargon and sounds like a clear boardroom explanation."
"So to begin, I ran a prompt in Google AI Studio to solve our problem"
"So what we see from putting that all in is here we have a visualization of the performance. Here we have our revenue, our expenses and our net income, and then also how those went up."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: defined the app purpose and required financial inputs (budget vs actual, identify variances).  
Implement: built the prototype in Google AI Studio and iterated prompts to produce outputs.  
Reflect: tested scenarios (including negatives) and refined outputs for non-financial audiences.
criteria.reasoning: The submission describes and demonstrates a working financial tool that accepts budgeted and actual figures, computes and visualizes variances, and generates executive explanations for non-financial users. Implementation and testing evidence (Google AI Studio prompts and scenario tests) show the app functions as a financial application, meeting the criterion.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "So to begin, I ran a prompt in Google AI Studio to solve our problem of creating an app that is an executive variance explainer"
"So I had to refine the prompt multiple times to make the language simpler and more business-focused."
"So it gives a good visualization of that, especially for someone who doesn't have that finance background and don't understand. And then it sends out an executive summary as well."
criteria.driver_alignment:
DISCOVER — defined the problem and target users (executive variance explainer for non-finance users).  
IMPLEMENT — used Google AI Studio, created prompts, iterated prompts and built an interactive demo producing visualizations and summaries.  
REFLECT — tested scenarios, refined prompts, and documented lessons for improving outputs and UX.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows concrete AI use (Google AI Studio) producing interactive outputs (visualizations and executive summaries) that add clear user value, and documents iterative prompt refinement and testing. These specifics across Discover/Implement/Reflect demonstrate effective AI integration beyond a superficial mention, so it passes.
